RankDef.description: A new enlistee in the Imperial Legion, undergoing basic training and learning military discipline.
A basic infantry soldier of the Imperial Legion, trained in spear and shield combat formation.
A standard legionnaire, competent in all basic military skills and ready for campaign duty.
A legion member tasked with intelligence gathering, investigations, and special operations.
An elite warrior who has proven themselves in combat, often serving as a role model for other legionnaires.
A squad leader responsible for training and leading small groups of legionnaires.
A commissioned officer of noble bearing, granted the honor of knighthood for service to the Empire.
A company commander responsible for 100-200 legionnaires and their tactical deployment.
A legion administrator responsible for logistics, supplies, and bureaucratic affairs.
A high-ranking officer commanding multiple centuries, responsible for strategic planning and execution.
A regional military commander overseeing multiple cohorts and garrison forces.
A senior military magistrate with both military and civilian authority in frontier regions.
The commanding officer of an entire legion, responsible for thousands of soldiers and major military operations.
A supreme military commander overseeing multiple legions and coordinating large-scale campaigns.
The highest military rank below the Emperor, commanding all Imperial forces in a theater of operations.
A veteran officer commanding a century of 80-100 legionnaires, the backbone of legion leadership.
A centurion's second-in-command and potential successor, handling administrative duties and training.
A standard-bearer responsible for carrying the legion's battle standards and maintaining unit cohesion.
The most honored standard-bearer, carrying the legion's golden eagle and defending it with their life.
The senior centurion of the first cohort, the most experienced and respected officer below the tribune rank.
